author: Ben Gao
title: would it be correct to say functions are non-primitive operators?
instructor_answer:
This language doesn't really have operators in the sense that many other languages do.  Calling an operator and calling a user defined function always look the same, so for example
(my-function (* 2 3))  ;the call to my-function follows the same rules as the call to *


myFunction(2 * 3)      // the call to myFunction has one set of rules, the operator * has another
This uniformity of calling rules is another advantage of the simple BSL language.
